alert.note: Alert for Litchfield (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 19 at 2:26PM EST until February 19 at 2:45PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EST FOR NORTHWESTERN LITCHFIELD...SOUTHERN BERKSHIRE...EAST CENTRAL ULSTER... NORTHERN DUTCHESS...COLUMBIA AND SOUTHWESTERN RENSSELAER COUNTIES... At 225 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near East Windsor to Rhinebeck, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Whiteout conditions. Zero visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 near exit 10. Interstate 87 between exits 19 and 20. Locations impacted include... Pittsfield, Kingston, East Greenbush, Great Barrington, Hudson, Saugerties, Rhinebeck, Chatham, Nassau, Hurley, Claverack, Lee, Lenox, Amenia, Livingston, Copake, Sheffield, Stephentown, Sharon and Pine Plains. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.
